page.title: 01Hexham a country market town
page.content: Hexham is in the south west of Northumberland.It lies on the south bank of the River Tyne about 3km east of the confluence of the rivers North Tyne and South Tyne.Most of the town is between 50 and 100m above sea level,and the Tyne valley is good fertile farming land.In 1981 the {population}was 9158,and of these 740 are unemployed.About one fifth travel away to work e.g.to Newcastle.104 are employed by Eggar U.K. a chipboard and laminate factory on the north of the river,while the rest work in shops, small industries, hospitals,schools etc. On{market}days,Tuesdays and Fridays many people come into the town to shop and to the livestock markets.It is popular with {tourists}who come to see the Abbey and nearby Roman remains and other places of historic interest.
